intro: Phaleria ixoroides, commonly known as the Malabar cassia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native habitat.
